main event: A radar operator observed an unidentified object for 3-4 seconds in Kettering, Ohio on December 15, 1963.
interesting points: The object was observed through a slight overcast, appearing to look like a signal rocket.
The object appeared to go out like a light, and was described as spherical with a trail.
The sighting lasted for only 3-4 seconds.
The Air Force concluded the sighting was likely a meteor.
No photographs were taken of the object.
sighted object: A spherical object with a trail
